column3: Reviewed all commits up to f66f592aea94701a2fccb2a608e05f93f298da5b except b7155a9e96ced01651888cda89aee1a68d696852 and 958431c2c3f18a651a87d33cb79d9c2dc786374b.\n

Verified b7155a9e96ced01651888cda89aee1a68d696852's code in aith_uint256.{h,cpp} to be a pure copy of the original code in uint256.{h,cpp}, apart from some type name changes, and _IMPORTANT_ 2 deleted trailing white spaces in the comments above SetCompact.\n
Untested ACK, but the code (both blob and arithmetic versions of it) looks well tested.\n

I've added a commit that (and left the rest untouched)\n- Removes direct `arith_uint256` initialization from byte vector. It is only used in the tests, so I've provided an alternative function there that just goes through `uint256`.\n- Implements GetHex and SetHex in terms of `uint256`. As these functions work bytewise and expect little-endian they belong there (also removes a bit of duplication).
Let's not let this go too unrebasable...\n
This isn't catched by git, only by the compiler, but needs rebase for 012598880cf69a6a4d4d495c78e40ab4abb4eb39 as it introduces `uint256(int)`s in pmt_tests.\n
Rebased for 012598880cf69a6a4d4d495c78e40ab4abb4eb39.\nIf Travis passes I'm just going to take the (minimal) risk and merge this, so that the big-endian patchset is easier to maintain.\n
